On bug reports here, your name will appear as a link in various places. Clicking on it results in a mail client firing up and offering to send yourself mail.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click your name on one of your own submitted bug reports on this site.

Actual Results:  
An email client fires up with a blank message addressed to yourself.

Expected Results:  
A profile page would load in the browser, with an email link whose link text was the email address and with links to all of one's submitted bugs, among perhaps other information and possibly, if it's your own profile page, tools to edit the profile in various ways; since this is what every other site in the known universe does if you click a site user's username that is a link.

There is, furthermore, no obvious alternative way to get at such a profile page or list links to one's own submitted bugs.

Thanks for the bug report Ken,

As you've pointed out, Bugzilla doesn't currently have a 'profile page' for users, so there's nothing we could change the link to right now :(

There is already a request to create a profile page, see bug 243944.

Until that bug has been resolved, you can use the 'My Bugs' link in the footer to see bugs that you've reported, and there's a 'User Changes' report on the 'Reports' page which has more detailed information.

-Byron

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 243944 ***
